E2.meaning: Initial should be pronounced with an /r/ sound at the end

E3.meaning: Phoneme is spoken differently than how it is spelled

C1.feedback: /p/ should be strongly aspirated, like 'p' in 'puff'

C2.feedback: /t/ should be strongly aspirated, like 't' in 'tickle'

C3.feedback: /k/ should be strongly aspirated, like 'k' in 'king'

C4.feedback: /sh/ should be pronounced with an /r/ sound at the end, like 'shirt'

C5.feedback: /zh/ should be pronounced with an /r/ sound at the end, like 'germ'

C6.feedback: /ch/ should be pronounced with an /r/ sound at the end, like 'chirp'

C7.feedback: /iu/ should be pronounced with an /o/ sound, like 'yo' in 'yogurt'

C9.feedback: /un/ should be pronounced like 'an’' in the phrase 'go an’ look'
